column2: We regret to inform you that one of our generals has been killed in action.  Histroic exapmles would include german flying ace Lothar von Richthofen, who was shot down over England in 1920, or british field marschal Douglas Haig, who was KIA during the British revolution.
column3: Nous sommes au regret de vous informer que l’un de nos généraux a été tué au combat.  L’histoire contient des cas similaires avec l’ex-chef de l’armée Werner von Fritsch (Varsovie, 1939), et quand l’avion de transport du général allemand Eugen von Schobert (TAC en 1941) , un Fieseler 'Storch', a atterri sur un champ de mines.
column4: Ci rincresce informarvi che uno dei nostri generali è rimasto ucciso sul campo. Nella storia si sono verificati altri decessi in simili circostanze: il precedente Capo dell'Esercito tedesco Werner von Fritsch (a Varsavia, nel 1939) o il Generale tedesco Eugen von Schobert (morto in battaglia nel 1941), quando l'aereo su cui volava, un Fieseler 'Storch', atterrò su un campo minato.
column5: Lamentamos informarte de que uno de tus generales ha muerto en combate. Ejemplos históricos incluirían al antiguo jefe del ejército Werner von Fritsch (en Varsovia en 1939), y al general alemán Eugen von Schobert (en 1941) cuando su avión de transporte, un Fieseler 'Storch' aterrizó en un campo de minas.
column6: Es tut uns leid, Sie darüber informieren zu müssen, dass einer unserer Generäle im Kampf gefallen ist. Zu den historischen Beispielen gehören der ehemalige Deutsche Armeeoberbefehlshaber Werner von Fritsch (Warschau 1939) und der deutsche General Eugen von Schobert (im Kampf gefallen 1941), als sein Transportflugzeug, ein Fieseler 'Storch' mitten in einem Minenfeld landete.
column7: Z bólem informujemy, ¿e jeden z naszych genera³ów poleg³ w walce. Historia zna takie przypadki: by³y niemiecki dowódca wojsk l¹dowych Werner von Fritsch (Warszawa, 1939), niemiecki genera³ Eugen von Schobert (1941, jego samolot transportowy Fieseler 'Storch' wyl¹dowa³ na polu minowym).
column9: We regret to inform you that one of our generals has been killed in action.  Histroic exapmles would include german flying ace Lothar von Richthofen, who was shot down over England in 1920, or british field marschal Douglas Haig, who was KIA during the British revolution.

column2: One of our generals retires
column3: Départ en retraite de l’un de nos généraux
column4: Uno dei nostri generali va in pensione
column5: Uno de nuestros generales se retira
column6: Einer unserer Generäle geht in den Ruhestand
column7: Jeden z naszych genera³ów odchodzi na emeryturê
column9: One of our generals retires

column2: Often generals retired from the military service because of old age, injuries or sometimes even because he got involved in politics, or was the victim of a smear campaign.
column3: La vieillesse est souvent l’une des raisons de départ en retraite des généraux, tout comme les blessures, un début de carrière politique, ou une campagne de détraction. L’histoire contient des cas similaires avec le chef allemand des Armées Werner von Fritsch, qui fut rétrogradé d’office dans la Wehrmacht après qu’une campagne bien orchestrée ait ‘révélé’ qu’il était homosexuel.
column4: Spesso i generali si ritirano dal servizio militare a causa dell'età avanzata, o di problemi fisici, o a volte perché entrano in politica o ancora perché sono bersaglio di una campagna diffamatoria. Nella storia si ricordano alcuni personaggi che subirono questa sorte, tra cui il Capo dell'Esercito tedesco Werner von Fritsch, che fu degradato e costretto a tornare alla Wehrmacht dopo che una campagna orchestrata ai suoi danni rivelò la sua omosessualità.
column5: A menudo los generales se retiraban del servicio activo debido a la edad, a heridas o a veces incluso por haberse metido en política o ser víctimas de una campaña de difamación. Un ejemplo histórico de ello sería el jefe del ejército alemán Werner von Fritsch, que fue degradado a la fuerza en la Wehrmacht tras una orquestada campaña que 'reveló' su homosexualidad.
column6: Manchmal ziehen sich Generäle aus dem Militärdienst ob ihres hohen Alters, wegen Verletzungen, politischer Begebenheiten, oder auch weil sie Opfer einer Schmutzkampagne werden zurück. Zu den historischen Beispielen gehört der deutsche Oberbefehlshaber der Armee Werner von Fritsch, der formell in der Wehrmacht degradiert wurde, nachdem eine gestellte Kampagne 'aufdeckte', dass er homosexuell war.
column7: Genera³owie przechodz¹ na emeryturê najczêœciej z powodu wieku, odniesionych ran, ale tak¿e w wyniku zaanga¿owania siê w politkê lub nacisków po skandalu. Historyczne przypadki obejmuj¹ niemieckiego dowódcê wojsk l¹dowych Wernera von Fritscha, którego pozbawiono stopnia po tym, jak znaleziono 'dowody' ujawniaj¹ce, ¿e jest on homoseksualist¹.
column9: Often generals retired from the military service because of old age, injuries or sometimes even because he got involved in politics, or was the victim of a smear campaign.

column2: A plot has been discovered involving one of our ministers, to over throw the government. Historical examples of politicians doing this are Ulrich von Hassel and Carl Goerdeler, who were both involved in the von Stauffenberg plot to kill Adolf Hitler. Both men were arrested by the Gestapo and hanged.
column3: Nous avons découvert un complot visant à renverser le gouvernement, dans lequel l'un de nos ministres est impliqué. L’histoire contient des cas similaires, avec les politiciens Ulrich von Hassel et Carl Goerdeler, tous deux responsables du complot von Stauffenberg destiné à tuer Adolf Hitler. Tous deux furent arrêtés par la Gestapo, et pendus.
column4: È stato scoperto un complotto ai danni del governo che vede protagonista uno dei nostri ministri. Altri uomini politici che nella storia hanno cercato di usurpare il potere del governo sono Ulrich von Hassel e Carl Goerdeler, entrambi coinvolti nel complotto di von Stauffenberg per uccidere Adolf Hitler. Furono arrestati tutti e due dalla Gestapo e impiccati.
column5: Se ha descubierto una conspiración para derrocar al gobierno que involucra a uno de nuestros ministros. Ejemplos históricos de políticos con esta conducta son Ulrich von Hassel y Carl Goerdeler, ambos envueltos en la trama de Stauffenberg para asesinar a Adolf Hitler. Los dos fueron arrestados por la Gestapo y posteriormente ahorcados.
column6: Eine Verschwörung wurde aufgedeckt, in die einer unserer Minister verwickelt war und bei der die Regierung gestürzt werden sollte. Zu den historischen Beispielen von Politikern, die sich so verhalten haben zählen Ulrich von Hassel und Carl Goerdeler, die beide an der Verschwörung von Stauffenberg beteiligt waren, bei der Adolf Hiller getötet werden sollte. Beide Männer wurden von der Gestapo verhaftet und gehängt.

column2: One of our generals has been plotting to topple our government in a coup.  Historical examples of military personnel being involved in such schemes are Ludwig Beck, Field Marshal Erwin von Witzleben and the celebrated Desert Fox Erwin Rommel who were all involved in the von Stauffenberg plot to kill Hitler. Von Witzleben was hanged by piano wires, Beck committed suicide, and Erwin Rommel was forced to commit suicide by taking cyanide to save the lives of his family.
column3: L’un de nos généraux complote contre notre gouvernement en préparant un coup d’état.  L’histoire contient des cas similaires, des militaires comme Ludwig Beck, le feld-maréchal Erwin von Witzleben et le célèbre ‘Renard du Désert’ Erwin Rommel, ayant tous impliqués dans le complot von Stauffenberg qui visait à tuer Hitler. Von Witzleben fut pendu avec des cordes de piano, Beck se suicida, et Erwin Rommel fut contraint au suicide par le cyanure pour sauver sa famille.
column4: Uno dei nostri generali è stato accusato di aver ordito un piano per rovesciare il governo con un colpo di stato. Nella storia ci sono altri esempi di militari coinvolti in simili complotti, tra cui: Ludwig Beck, il Feldmaresciallo Erwin von Witzleben e la celebre volpe del deserto Erwin Rommel, tutti coinvolti nella cospirazione di von Stauffenberg per uccidere Hitler. Von Witzleben fu impiccato con le corde di un pianoforte, Beck si suicidò e Erwin Rommel Erwin Rommel fu costretto a uccidersi ingerendo cianuro per salvare i componenti della sua famiglia.
column5: Uno de nuestros generales tramaba derribar nuestro a gobierno con un golpe. Ejemplos históricos de militares involucrados en intrigas similares son Ludwig Beck, el mariscal de campo Erwin von Witzleben y el famoso Zorro del Desierto, Erwin Rommel, todos ellos relacionados con la trama de von Stauffenberg para asesinar a Hitler. Von Witzleben fue colgado con cuerdas de piano, Beck se suicidó y Erwin Rommel fue obligado a suicidarse con cianuro para salvar la vida de su familia.
column6: Einer unserer Generäle ist an der Verschwörung zum Sturz unserer Regierung beteiligt gewesen. Zu den historischen Beispielen bei denen militärisches Personal in derartige Schemata verwickelt waren gehören Ludwig Beck, Feldmarschall Erwin von Witzleben und der berühmte Wüstenfuchs Erwin Rommel, die alle an der Verschwörung von Stauffenberg beteiligt waren, bei der Hiller getötet werden sollte. Von Witzleben wurde mit Klavierseiten gehängt, Beck beging Selbstmord und Erwin Rommel wurde zum Selbstmord durch Zyanid gezwungen um das Leben seiner Familie zu retten.

column2: For many years the socialists and liberals have undermined our defense. We therefore suggest that we increase the professionalism of the armed forces and that we strengthen the bonds between civil society and the armed forces.

column4: Per molti anni i socialisti e i liberali hanno minato la nostra difesa. Per questo proponiamo di incrementare la professionalità degli eserciti armati e di rinforzare il legame tra la società civile e il potere militare.
column5: Durante muchos años, los socialistas y los liberales han socavado nuestra defensa. Por tanto, sugerimos el aumento de la profesionalidad en las fuerzas armadas y el fortalecimiento de los lazos entre ellas y la sociedad civil.
column6: Viele Jahre lang haben die Sozialisten und Liberalen unsere Verteidigung untergraben. Wir schlagen deshalb vor, dass wir die Professionalität der Streitkräfte erhöhen und so die Bindung zwischen der Zivilgesellschaft und den Streitkräften stärken.

column2: For many years the socialists and liberals have undermined our economy. We therefore suggest that we take control of the economy by sound regulations and protective measures.
column3: Depuis de nombreuses années, socialistes et libéraux minent notre économie. Nous suggérons par conséquent une prise de contrôle de l’économie en introduisant des réglementations judicieuses et des mesures de protection.
column4: Per molti anni i socialisti e i liberali hanno minacciato la nostra economia. Per questo proponiamo di assumere il controllo dell'economia attraverso l'introduzione di regolamentazioni e misure di difesa.
column5: Durante muchos años, los socialistas y los liberales han minado nuestra economía. Por tanto, sugerimos tomar el control de la economía mediante doctrinas sólidas y medidas proteccionistas.
column6: Viele Jahre lang haben die Sozialisten und Liberalen unsere Wirtschaft untergraben. Wir schlagen deshalb vor, dass wir die Kontrolle über unsere Wirtschaft durch klare Regelungen und vorbeugende Maßnahmen übernehmen.

column2: For many years the socialists and liberals have lived in a fairy land of idealism, trusting such preposterous institutions as the League of Nations and the Workers’ International. It is time for a pure and glorious national foreign policy.
column3: Depuis de nombreuses années, socialistes comme libéraux vivent dans un pays utopique et féerique, accordant leur confiance à des institutions ridicules comme la Ligue des Nations et l’Internationale des Ouvriers L’heure d’une politique étrangère nationale pure et glorieuse est arrivée.
column4: Per molti anni i socialisti e i liberali hanno vissuto in un mondo di artefatto idealismo, dando fiducia a ridicole istituzioni quali la Lega delle Nazioni e L'Organizzazione Internazionale dei Lavoratori. È giunto il momento di introdurre una politica estera che dia prestigio e gloria alla nostra nazione.
column5: Durante muchos años, los socialistas y los liberales han vivido en un país de fantasía e idealismo, confiando en absurdas instituciones como la Sociedad de Naciones y la Internacional de Trabajadores. Ya es hora de tener una política exterior nacional pura y gloriosa.
column6: Seit vielen Jahren schon leben die Sozialisten und Liberalen in einer idealistischen Traumwelt, die solch angesehenen Institutionen wie der Völker- und Arbeiterbund (League of Nations und Workers) (International vertraut. Die Zeit für eine eindeutige und glorreiche nationale Außenpolitik ist gekommen.

column9: For many years the socialists and liberals have lived in a fairy land of idealism, trusting such preposterous institutions as the League of Nations and the Workers’ International. It is time for a pure and glorious national foreign policy.

column2: For many years, Socialists and Liberals have run amok with the legislative system. Illusory concepts such as human rights and freedom from responsibility have created complete anarchy. We are now setting this country back on the right track with order, censorship and the good old rule of law.
column3: Depuis de nombreuses années, les Socialistes et les Libéraux ont perdu tout contrôle du système législatif. Des concepts illusoires comme les droits de l’homme et l’absence de responsabilité ont généré l'anarchie la plus totale. Nous remettons aujourd’hui ce pays sur le droit chemin grâce à l’ordre, la censure et les bonnes vieilles règles législatives.
column4: Per molti anni, i socialisti e i liberali hanno gestito in modo folle il sistema legislativo. I concetti illusori come i diritti umani e la libertà dalle responsabilità hanno portato a una totale anarchia. Adesso stiamo cercando di riportare questo paese sui giusti binari, ristabilendo l'ordine, la censura e il ripristino della legge.
column5: Durante muchos años, los socialistas y los liberales han sembrado el caos en el sistema legislativo. Conceptos ilusorios como los derechos humanos y la falta de responsabilidad han creado la anarquía más absoluta. Ahora vamos a devolver a este país al camino correcto mediante el orden, la censura y el viejo y adecuado imperio de la ley.
column6: Viele Jahre lang schon sind die Sozialisten und Liberalen mit der Legislative Amok gelaufen. Illusorische Konzepte wie z.B. Menschenrechte und freie Entscheidung haben eine totale Anarchie hervorgebracht. Wir bringen dieses Land jetzt durch Ordnung, Zensur und das gute alte Rechtssystem zurück auf den rechten Weg.

column9: For many years, Socialists and Liberals have run amok with the legislative system. Illusory concepts such as human rights and freedom from responsibility have created complete anarchy. We are now setting this country back on the right track with order, censorship and the good old rule of law.

column2: Democracy has not fared well under the rule of levelling and egoism. It is time we find its essence, by conservative reform under the formula - Progress without change.
column3: La démocratie est loin d’avoir prospéré sous le règne de l’égoïsme et de l’égalité. Il est temps pour nous d’en trouver l’essence, en introduisant une réforme conservatrice dont le fil directeur sera ‘Progresser sans changer’.
column4: La democrazia non ha funzionato applicando le regole di parità ed egoismo. È ora di trovare la sua essenza, con una riforma che segua la formula: progresso senza cambiamento.
column5: A la democracia no le ha ido bien bajo el gobierno de la igualdad y el egoísmo. Es hora de que hallemos su esencia mediante una reforma conservadora con la fórmula de 'progreso sin cambio'.
column6: Die Demokratie hat es unter dem Versuch der Egalisierung und des Egoismus nicht weit gebracht. Es wird Zeit, dass wir uns auf die Grundlagen besinnen - durch konservative Reformen frei nach der Formel Fortschritt ohne Veränderungen.

column9: Democracy has not fared well under the rule of levelling and egoism. It is time we find its essence, by conservative reform under the formula - Progress without change.

column2: What this country needs right now is a defense that is fiscally sound and is constructed around the citizenry. Our defense industry must also be allowed a role in creating a new defense to ensure competence and technological soundness.
column3: Ce dont notre pays a besoin aujourd’hui, c’est d’une politique de défense élaborée autour de la citoyenneté, et à la fiscalité solide. Pour que nos compétences et notre technologies soient saines, notre industrie de la défense doit pouvoir avoir un rôle dans la création d’une nouvelle défense.
column4: Ciò che serve al nostro paese in questo momento è una solida difesa, costruita intorno alla cittadinanza. La nostra industria della difesa deve anche avere un ruolo nella creazione di una nuova forza difensiva efficace da un punto di vista di competenze e tecnologia.
column5: Lo que este país necesita ahora mismo es una defensa fiscalmente sólida y construida alrededor de la ciudadanía. Además, a nuestra industria militar se le debe dar un papel en la creación de una nueva defensa para asegurar la competencia y la solidez tecnológica.
column6: Was dieses Land jetzt braucht ist eine grundlegende Verteidigung, die von den Bürgern ausgeht. Unserer Verteidigungsindustrie muss auch eine Rolle bei der Schaffung neuer Verteidigungsstrategien zugestanden werden um Kompetenz und technologische Haltbarkeit zu sichern.

column9: What this country needs right now is a defense that is fiscally sound and is constructed around the citizenry. Our defense industry must also be allowed a role in creating a new defense to ensure competence and technological soundness.

column2: The unlimited spending and inefficient regulations of both Conservatives and Socialists have hurt our economy. We must now ensure free trade and an economy free of state interventionism.
column3: Les dépenses effrénées et la réglementation inefficace des Conservateurs et des Socialistes ont mis notre économie à mal . Nous devons aujourd’hui garantir le libre échange et une économie libre de tout interventionnisme d’état.
column4: Le ingenti spese e le regolamentazioni inefficienti di matrice conservatrice e socialista hanno danneggiato la nostra economia. Dobbiamo garantire il libero commercio e un'economia libera da interventismi.
column5: El gasto ilimitado y las regulaciones ineficaces de los conservadores y los socialistas han dañado nuestra economía. Ahora debemos asegurar el libre comercio y una economía sin intervencionismo del estado.
column6: Die unbegrenzten Ausgaben und die ineffizienten Regelungen der Konservativen und Sozialisten haben unserer Wirtschaft schweren Schaden zugefügt. Wir müssen jetzt den freien Handel und eine Wirtschaft sichern, die frei ist von jeglicher staatlicher Intervention.
column7: Nielimitowane wydatki i nieefektywna regulacja ze strony zarówno konserwatystów, jak i socjalistów, zaszkodzi³y naszej gospodarce. Musimy promowaæ wolny handel i model ekonomiczny wolny od regulacji pañstwowych.
column9: The unlimited spending and inefficient regulations of both Conservatives and Socialists have hurt our economy. We must now ensure free trade and an economy free of state interventionism.

column2: Meddling in the affairs of other nations is not in the interest of this great nation. We had better run our own business and ensure freedom and opportunity for our citizens and not embroil ourselves in foreign conflicts.
column3: Se mêler des affaires des autres nations n’est pas dans l’intérêt de ce grand pays. Mieux vaut gérer nos propres affaires, garantir à nos citoyens liberté et opportunités, et ne pas nous laisser entraîner dans des conflits étrangers.
column4: Intromettersi negli affari di altre nazioni non è nell'interesse di questo grande paese. È preferibile gestire al meglio i nostri affari e assicurare libertà e opportunità per i cittadini, piuttosto che restare coinvolti in conflitti esterni.
column5: No es provechoso para esta gran nación el entrometerse en los asuntos de otros países. Sería mejor ocuparnos de nuestros propios asuntos y garantizar la libertad y las oportunidades para nuestros ciudadanos, y no enzarzarnos en conflictos externos.
column6: Sich in die Affären anderer Nationen einzumischen ist nicht das Ziel dieser großartigen Nation. Wir sollten uns besser um unsere eigenen Probleme kümmern und unseren Bürgern Freiheit und Wohlstand sichern und uns nicht in außenpolitische Konflikte einmischen.
column7: Mieszanie siê do w sprawy innych pañstw nie le¿y w interesie naszego wspania³ego narodu. Musimy bardziej pilnowaæ w³asnego podwórka i zapewniæ dobrobyt naszym obywatelom, zamiast wik³aæ siê w cudze k³opoty.
column9: Meddling in the affairs of other nations is not in the interest of this great nation. We had better run our own business and ensure freedom and opportunity for our citizens and not embroil ourselves in foreign conflicts.

column2: We denounce class society, be it aristocracy or communism. Man was born naturally equal and free. The state must now refrain from meddling in the life of the ordinary citizen.
column3: Nous dénonçons la séparation des classes, qu’elle soit aristocratique ou communiste. Tous les hommes naissent libres et égaux. L’état doit désormais éviter de se mêler de la vie du citoyen ordinaire.
column4: Denunciamo la società classista, sia essa aristocratica o comunista. L'uomo nasce uguale e libero. I cittadini devono esseri liberi dalle ingerenze dello stato.
column5: Condenamos la sociedad de clases, ya sea aristocracia o comunismo. El hombre nació originariamente igual y libre. Ahora el estado debe abstenerse de intervenir en la vida del ciudadano ordinario.
column6: Wir verurteilen die Klassengesellschaft, unabhängig davon ob sie aristokratisch oder kommunistisch ausgelegt ist. Alle Menschen sind von Geburt an gleich und frei. Der Staat muss sich aus dem Leben der normalen Bürger des Landes raushalten.
column7: Wyrzekamy siê spo³eczeñstwa klasowego, czy to arystokracji, czy komunizmu. Cz³owiek rodzi siê wolny i równy innym. Pañstwo musi przestaæ wtr¹caæ siê do ¿ycia swoich obywateli.
column9: We denounce class society, be it aristocracy or communism. Man was born naturally equal and free. The state must now refrain from meddling in the life of the ordinary citizen.

column2: Democracy needs freedom and justice to flourish. These core values have been abused by both Socialists and Conservatives in the effort to control and strangle the individual in our country. Let us therefore rebuild democracy.
column3: Pour prospérer, la démocratie a besoin de liberté et de justice. Les Socialistes comme les Conservateurs ont abusé de ces valeurs essentielles, avides de contrôler et d’étrangler les citoyens de notre pays. Il nous faut donc reconstruire la démocratie.
column4: La democrazia ha bisogno di libertà e giustizia per prosperare. Questi valori fondamentali sono stati sfruttati da socialisti e conservatori per poter controllare e soffocare ogni individuo di questo paese. Per questo, impegniamoci tutti per ricostruire la democrazia.
column5: La democracia necesita libertad y justicia para prosperar. Tanto los socialistas como los conservadores han abusado de estos valores centrales en su esfuerzo por controlar y estrangular al individuo en nuestro país. Por consiguiente, reconstruiremos la democracia.
column6: Die Demokratie baut auf Freiheit und Gerechtigkeit. Diese Kernwerte wurden sowohl von den Sozialisten als auch von den Konservativen bei ihren Bemühungen verletzt, die Bürger in unserem Land zu kontrollieren und zu überwachen. Wir sollten daher die Demokratie wieder aufbauen.
column7: Demokracja wymaga do rozkwitu wolnoœci i sprawiedliwoœci. Te podstawowe wartoœci zosta³y sponiewierane przez socjalistów i konserwatystów w celu osi¹gniêcia kontroli i zduszenia indywidualizmu jednostki – zbudujmy wiêc demokracjê od nowa.
column9: Democracy needs freedom and justice to flourish. These core values have been abused by both Socialists and Conservatives in the effort to control and strangle the individual in our country. Let us therefore rebuild democracy.

column2: The Old Right talks about defense, but it is not defense they are planning for, but war. They are hawkish and arrogant. We need a professional defense of high quality, but our conviction is that peace can only be assured by means of diplomacy and international cooperation.
column3: La Vieille Droite parle de défense, pourtant ce n’est pas une défense qu’il préparent, mais la guerre. Quels bellicistes arrogants ! Nous avons besoin d’une défense professionnelle de la plus grande qualité, mais sommes convaincus que la paix ne peut être garantie que par la coopération internationale et la diplomatie.
column4: Il Vecchio Diritto parla di difesa, ma qui nessuno sta pianificando una difesa, piuttosto una guerra. Sono aguzzini arroganti. Abbiamo bisogno di una difesa professionale di alta qualità, ma siamo convinti che la pace possa essere raggiunta solo tramite la diplomazia e la collaborazione internazionale.
column5: La vieja derecha habla de defenderse, pero no es eso lo que tienen en mente, sino la guerra. Son arrogantes e intransigentes. Necesitamos una defensa profesional de gran calidad, pero creemos que la paz sólo puede asegurarse mediante la diplomacia y la cooperación internacional.
column6: Die Alten Rechte sprechen von Verteidigung, es ist jedoch keine Verteidigung die sie planen, sondern Krieg. Das ist wucherisch und arrogant. Wir benötigen dringend eine professionelle und qualitativ hochwertige Verteidigung, aber unsere Überzeugung ist auch, dass der Frieden nur durch Diplomatie und internationale Zusammenarbeit gesichert werden kann.
column7: Stare prawa mówi¹ o obronie, ale w rzeczywistoœci maj¹ na celu planowanie wojny. S¹ butne i aroganckie. Potrzebujemy profesjonalnej i skutecznej obrony, ale uwa¿amy ¿e pokój mog¹ zagwarantowaæ tylko œrodki dyplomatyczne i miêdzynarodowa wspó³praca.
column9: The Old Right talks about defense, but it is not defense they are planning for, but war. They are hawkish and arrogant. We need a professional defense of high quality, but our conviction is that peace can only be assured by means of diplomacy and international cooperation.

column2: Our nation affirms the values of freedom and a free market. However, if 'freedom' is merely the right to choose where in this beautiful country one is free to starve, then we say no. We choose instead freedom and responsibility, which demand both a free market and a system of social security.
column3: Notre nation s’attache aux valeurs de la liberté et du libre échange. Toutefois, si ‘être libre’ dans ce magnifique pays veut dire ‘mourir de faim dans le lieu de son choix’, nous refusons cette liberté. Choisissons le type de responsabilité et liberté pour lesquelles un marché de libre échange et un système de sécurité sociale sont indispensables.
column4: La nostra nazione afferma i valori di libertà e libero mercato. A ogni modo, se per libertà si intende semplicemente poter scegliere dove, in questo bellissimo paese, si può morire di fame, noi diciamo no. Noi scegliamo piuttosto la libertà e la responsabilità, che richiedono entrambe sia un mercato libero che un sistema di sicurezza sociale.
column5: Nuestra nación garantiza los valores de la libertad y el libre mercado. No obstante, si la 'libertad' no es más que el derecho a elegir dónde es uno libre de morir de hambre en este hermoso país, entonces decimos no. En vez de eso escogemos la libertad y la responsabilidad, que exigen tanto un mercado libre como un sistema de seguridad social.
column6: Unsere Nation unterschreibt das Streben nach Freiheit und eines freien Marktes. Wenn 'Freiheit' jedoch nur bedeutet, dass es jedem in diesem wunderschönen Land freisteht zu entscheiden, wo er an Hunger sterben wird, dann sagen wir dazu NEIN. Wir entscheiden uns stattdessen für Freiheit und Verantwortlichkeit, die sowohl einen freien Markt als auch ein System der sozialen Sicherheit erfordern.
column7: Nasz naród popiera wolnoœæ i wolny rynek. Jeœli jednak 'wolnoœæ' oznacza prawo wybrania miejsca w tym piêknym kraju, w którym siê umrze z g³odu, to mówimy stanowcze 'nie'. Wybieramy raczej wolnoœæ i odpowiedzialnoœæ, które wymagaj¹ zarówno wolnego rynku, jak i systemu opieki spo³ecznej.
column9: Our nation affirms the values of freedom and a free market. However, if 'freedom' is merely the right to choose where in this beautiful country one is free to starve, then we say no. We choose instead freedom and responsibility, which demand both a free market and a system of social security.

column2: We cherish the weaker members of our society and hold them dear. But should freedom be so strangled that the economic pie were to shrink from year to year, then it would be irresponsible to insist that it be divided equally. We will create instead a balanced economic policy.
column3: Notre société aime et sait reconnaître à leur juste valeur les plus faibles de nos citoyens. Mais si notre liberté devait être à tel point étranglée que le pain de notre économie venait à diminuer d’année en année, il serait irresponsable d’insister sur une division égalitaire. Créons une politique économique équilibrée.
column4: Abbiamo a cuore i membri più deboli della nostra società e siamo loro vicini. Ma la libertà è stata soffocata a tal punto che la torta economica si è ridotta di anno in anno, quindi è da incoscienti insistere sul fatto che vada divisa equamente. Dobbiamo invece creare una politica economica equilibrata.
column5: Apreciamos y estimamos a los miembros más débiles de nuestra sociedad. Pero si la libertad quedara tan estrangulada como para reducir de año en año el pastel de la economía, entonces sería irresponsable insistir en dividirlo equitativamente. En lugar de eso crearemos una política económica equilibrada.
column6: Wir kümmern uns um die schwachen Mitglieder in unserer Gesellschaft. Aber sollte die Freiheit so weit beschnitten werden, dass der wirtschaftliche Kuchen von Jahr zu Jahr kleiner wird, dann wäre es unverantwortlich, weiter davon auszugehen, dass er in gleiche Teile aufgeteilt wird. Wir werden stattdessen eine ausgewogene Wirtschaftspolitik anstreben.
column7: Nie walczymy ze s³abszymi cz³onkami naszego spo³eczeñstwa. Ale czy rzeczywiœcie rozwój ekonomiczny musi byæ co roku hamowany przez wydatki na cele socjalne? Musimy pomyœleæ o zmianie zbilansowania gospodarki.
column9: We cherish the weaker members of our society and hold them dear. But should freedom be so strangled that the economic pie were to shrink from year to year, then it would be irresponsible to insist that it be divided equally. We will create instead a balanced economic policy.

column2: Warmongers have led our country for far too long. These are men who define the 'national interest' in terms of the number of foreigners they have trampled on. But we don't care about foreigners, we care only about our sons and daughters. We cannot accept them coming home in body bags. Thus, there will be no new wars. War must end.
column3: Les bellicistes dirigent notre pays depuis beaucoup trop longtemps. Ces hommes définissent ‘l’intérêt national’ en terme de nombre d’étrangers foulés au pied. Peu importe les étrangers, seuls nos fils et nos filles comptent. Nous ne pouvons accepter de les voir revenir dans des housses mortuaires. C’est pourquoi il n’y aura plus aucune nouvelle guerre. La guerre doit prendre fin.
column4: I guerrafondai hanno governato il nostro paese per troppo tempo. Questi sono uomini che definiscono l'interesse del paese in termini di quanti stranieri hanno sconfitto. Ma a noi non interessa degli stranieri, pensiamo solo al bene dei nostri figli. Non possiamo accettare che tornino a casa nelle bare. Quindi, non ci saranno altre guerre. La guerra deve finire.
column5: 'Los belicistas han dirigido nuestro país durante demasiado tiempo. Son hombres que definen el 'interés nacional' en función de la cantidad de extranjeros que han pisoteado. Pero a nosotros no nos importan los extranjeros, sólo nos preocupan nuestros hijos. No podemos aceptar que vuelvan a casa en ataúdes. Por tanto, no habrá más guerras. La guerra debe terminar.'
column6: Die Kriegshetzer haben unser Land schon viel zu lange befehligt. Das sind die Männer, welche die 'nationalen Interessen' im Sinne der Anzahl der Ausländer messen, die sie zertreten haben. Uns sind jedoch die Ausländer weitgehend egal, was uns wichtig ist sind unsere Söhne und Töchter. Wir akzeptieren einfach nicht, dass sie in Leichensäcken nach Hause kommen. Es wird also keine neuen Kriege mehr geben. Der Krieg muss endlich aufhören.
column7: Zwolennicy wojny zbyt d³ugo przewodzili naszym pañstwem. To ci, którzy licz¹ 'interes narodowy' w iloœci obcokrajowców, których zdeptali. Ale nas obcokrajowcy nie obchodz¹, dla nas licz¹ siê tylko nasi synowie i nasze córki. Nie mo¿emy dopuœciæ, by wracali do swych domów w trumnach. A wiêc nie bêdzie ¿adnych nowych wojen. Wojna musi siê skoñczyæ.
column9: Warmongers have led our country for far too long. These are men who define the 'national interest' in terms of the number of foreigners they have trampled on. But we don't care about foreigners, we care only about our sons and daughters. We cannot accept them coming home in body bags. Thus, there will be no new wars. War must end.

column2: We do not trust an army that represents bourgeois society. We demand instead a Workers' Army, an army that can promote peace, not war. Such an army will never fight outside our borders, because it acts solely for defense and not as a vehicle of international imperialist capitalism, in contrast to the current force of capitalist mercenaries.
column3: Nous ne faisons pas confiance en une armée qui représente la société bourgeoise. Nous exigeons en revanche une Armée du peuple ouvrier, à même d’encourager la paix, pas la guerre. Une armée de ce type ne combattra jamais hors de nos frontières, elle sera défensive, et à l’opposé de notre armée actuelle, composée de mercenaires capitalistes, elle n’aura pas le rôle de véhicule du capitalisme impérialiste international.
column4: Non crediamo in un esercito che rappresenta la società borghese. Chiediamo, invece, un esercito dei lavoratori, che possa promuovere la pace, non la guerra. Un esercito così composto non combatterà mai oltre i nostri confini, perché agirà esclusivamente come strumento di difesa e non come mezzo del capitalismo imperialista internazionale, in opposizione all'esercito attuale composto da mercenari del capitalismo.
column5: No confiamos en un ejército que representa a la sociedad burguesa. En su lugar exigimos un ejército del proletariado, un ejército que promueva la paz, no la guerra. Tal ejército jamás lucharía fuera de nuestras fronteras, porque actuaría únicamente para defender y no como vehículo del capitalismo imperialista internacional, al contrario que la actual fuerza de mercenarios capitalistas.
column6: Wir trauen keiner Armee, die eine bürgerliche Gesellschaft repräsentiert. Wir fordern stattdessen eine Arbeiterarmee, eine, die den Frieden propagiert, nicht den Krieg. Solch eine Armee wird nie außerhalb unserer Grenzen kämpfen, da sie nur als Verteidigungsarmee dient und nicht als Mittel für internationalen imperialistischen Kapitalismus, ganz im Gegensatz zu den aktuellen Streitkräften kapitalistischer Söldner.
column7: Nie ufamy armii reprezentuj¹cej interesy bur¿uazji. Domagamy siê Armii Robotniczej, takiej, która bêdzie promowaæ pokój, nie wojnê. Taka armia nie bêdzie nigdy walczyæ poza naszymi granicami, gdy¿ dzia³aæ bêdzie wy³¹cznie w obronie, a nie jako narzêdzie miêdzynarodowego, imperialistycznego kapitalizmu.
column9: We do not trust an army that represents bourgeois society. We demand instead a Workers' Army, an army that can promote peace, not war. Such an army will never fight outside our borders, because it acts solely for defense and not as a vehicle of international imperialist capitalism, in contrast to the current force of capitalist mercenaries.

column2: The Capitalists are oppressing us with devilish new economic instruments, such as free Trade, no regulation of trade, minimal taxes, and of course, no policies to promote equality. This makes them nothing but butchers and tyrants. But we will use taxes as an instrument for leveling this society. The upper classes will disappear - this we promise.
column3: Les capitalistes nous oppressent avec de nouveaux outils économiques diaboliques comme le libre échange, la déréglementation des échanges commerciaux, de faibles impôts et bien entendu, une politique dénuée de lois promulguant l'égalité. Ceci fait tout simplement d’eux des bouchers et des tyrans. Nous allons adopter les taxes comme outils de nivellement de cette société. La classe supérieure disparaîtra – nous vous en faisons la promesse.
column4: I capitalisti ci stanno opprimendo usando subdoli strumenti della nuova economia, come libero mercato, nessuna regolamentazione per il commercio, tasse minime e, ovviamente, senza alcuna politica per promuovere l'uguaglianza. Per questo non sono altro che strozzini e tiranni. Ma noi useremo le tasse come strumento per livellare la società. Le classi più elevate spariranno: questa è una promessa.
column5: Los capitalistas están oprimiéndonos con nuevos instrumentos diabólicos como el libre comercio o los impuestos mínimos y, por supuesto, no tienen política que promueva la igualdad. Esto los convierte en carniceros y tiranos. Pero nosotros usaremos los impuestos como instrumento de equilibrio para esta sociedad. Las clases superiores desaparecerán, lo prometemos.
column6: Die Kapitalisten unterdrücken uns mit teuflischen neuen wirtschaftlichen Mitteln, wie z.B. den freien Handel, keine Regelung des Handels, minimalen Steuern, und natürlich auch keine Gesetzesvorlagen um die Gleichheit zu promovieren. Das führt dazu, dass sie alle zu Metzgern und Tyrannen werden. Wir werden jedoch die Steuern nutzen, um diese Gesellschaft wieder auf ein gesundes Maß zu bringen. Die Oberschicht wird verschwinden - das versprechen wir.
column7: Kapitaliœci uciskaj¹ nas diabelskimi instrumentami nowej ekonomii, takimi jak wolny handel, brak regulacji, minimalne podatki i oczywiœcie brak polityki równoœci. To czyni ich rzeŸnikami i tyranami. My wykorzystamy podatki do wyrównania ró¿nic bytowych spo³eczeñstwa. Wy¿sze klasy znikn¹ ostatecznie – to wam przyrzekamy.
column9: The Capitalists are oppressing us with devilish new economic instruments, such as free Trade, no regulation of trade, minimal taxes, and of course, no policies to promote equality. This makes them nothing but butchers and tyrants. But we will use taxes as an instrument for leveling this society. The upper classes will disappear - this we promise.

column2: Our working comrades abroad face harsh pressure from both Capitalist and Fascist regmes. We must prepare ourselves for the final battle, for we cannot stand idly by while workers' governments are toppled one by one.
column3: Nos camarades ouvriers font face, à l’étranger, à des pressions insupportables sous les régimes capitalistes et fascistes. Nous devons nous préparer à la lutte finale, car nous ne pouvons rester les bras croisés alors que des gouvernements ouvriers sont renversés l’un après l’autre.
column4: I nostri compagni lavoratori stranieri stanno subendo pesanti pressioni dai regimi capitalista e fascista. Dobbiamo prepararci alla battaglia finale, poiché non possiamo più rimanere immobili a guardare mentre i governi dei lavoratori vengono fatti cadere uno a uno.
column5: Nuestros camaradas obreros en el extranjero se enfrentan a una fuerte presión de los regímenes capitalista y fascista. Debemos prepararnos para la batalla final, porque no podemos permanecer impasibles mientras los gobiernos de los trabajadores son derrocados uno por uno.
column6: Unsere arbeitenden Kameraden im Ausland leiden unter dem unglaublichen Druck der kapitalistischen und faschistischen Regimes. Wir müssen uns auf den Endkampf vorbereiten, denn wir können nicht einfach dabeistehen und zusehen, während die Arbeiterregierungen eine nach der anderen gestürzt werden.
column7: Nasi towarzysze pracuj¹cy za granic¹ s¹ uciskani zarówno przez kapitalistów, jak i faszystów. Musimy przygotowaæ siê do ostatecznej bitwy, nie mo¿emy staæ bezczynnie podczas gdy rz¹dy robotnicze s¹ jeden po drugim obalane.
column9: Our working comrades abroad face harsh pressure from both Capitalist and Fascist regmes. We must prepare ourselves for the final battle, for we cannot stand idly by while workers' governments are toppled one by one.

column2: The Old Right talks about freedom, but what they don't say is that it is only the freedom of some and not the freedom of the many. True freedom can only exist where society is truly equal. 'Liberal' freedom is a misnomer that must be corrected.
column3: La Vieille Droite parle de liberté, mais il s’agit de la liberté de quelques-uns, au détriment de la liberté des masses. La vraie liberté ne peut exister que dans une société réellement égalitaire. La liberté ‘libérale’ est un terme impropre qu’il nous faut corriger.
column4: Il Vecchio Diritto parla di libertà, ma quello che non dice è che si tratta di libertà solo di pochi, non della massa. La vera libertà può esistere solo in una società davvero eguale. La libertà 'liberale' è un termine improprio che va corretto.
column5: La vieja derecha habla de libertad, pero lo que no dicen es que es una libertad sólo para algunos y no para muchos. La verdadera libertad sólo puede existir en una sociedad igualitaria de verdad. La libertad 'liberal' es un nombre impropio que debe ser corregido.
column6: Die Alten Rechte verkünden die Freiheit - was sie aber verschweigen ist, dass es dabei nur um die Freiheit einiger weniger geht und nicht um die Freiheit von allen. Echte Freiheit kann nur dort bestehen, wo die Gesellschaft gleichgestellt ist. Die 'liberale' Freiheit ist ein unzutreffender Name, der korrigiert werden muss.
column7: Stare prawa mówi¹ o wolnoœci, ale nie wyjaœniaj¹, ¿e jest to wolnoœæ kilku a nie wolnoœæ wielu. Prawdziwa wolnoœæ mo¿e istnieæ tylko w spo³eczeñstwie prawdziwie równym. 'Liberalna' wolnoœæ to tylko b³êdne okreœlenie, które trzeba skorygowaæ.
column9: The Old Right talks about freedom, but what they don't say is that it is only the freedom of some and not the freedom of the many. True freedom can only exist where society is truly equal. 'Liberal' freedom is a misnomer that must be corrected.

column2: The Capitalists and Aristocrats, with their greed and corruption, have nearly destroyed democracy. We have no intention of rebuilding the injustices of bourgeois pseudodemocracy. We will build a real democracy, in which capitalists and aristocrats will be held on a short leash.
column3: Les capitalistes et les aristocrates ont, avec leur corruption et leur avidité, quasiment détruit la démocratie. Nous n’avons nullement l’intention de reproduire les injustices de la pseudo-démocratie bourgeoise. Nous construirons une vraie démocratie dans laquelle nous tiendrons la bride haute aux capitalistes et aux aristocrates.
column4: I capitalisti e gli aristocratici, animati da avidità e corruzione, hanno quasi distrutto la democrazia. Non abbiamo alcuna intenzione di restaurare le ingiustizie della pseudodemocrazia borghese. Costruiremo una democrazia vera, in cui i capitalisti e gli aristocratici non avranno il potere di dettare legge.
column5: Los capitalistas y los aristócratas, con su avaricia y su corrupción, han destruido la democracia casi por completo. No tenemos intención de reconstruir las injusticias de la pseudodemocracia burguesa. Construiremos una democracia real, en la que se atará en corto a los capitalistas y los aristócratas.
column6: Die Kapitalisten und Aristokraten haben mit ihrer Gier und Korruption die Demokratie fast vernichtet. Wir sehen keinerlei Veranlassung, die Ungerechtigkeiten bürgerlicher Pseudodemokratie wieder aufzubauen. Wir werden eine echte Demokratie aufbauen, in der Kapitalisten und Aristokraten gleichermaßen an der kurzen Leine gehalten werden.
column7: Kapitaliœci i arystokraci, w swej chciwoœci i korupcji, niemal zniszczyli demokracjê. Nie mamy zamiaru odbudowywaæ niesprawiedliwoœci tej bur¿uazyjnej pseudodemokracji. Stworzymy prawdziw¹ demokracjê, w której kapitaliœci i arystokraci bêd¹ trzymani na krótkiej smyczy.
column9: The Capitalists and Aristocrats, with their greed and corruption, have nearly destroyed democracy. We have no intention of rebuilding the injustices of bourgeois pseudodemocracy. We will build a real democracy, in which capitalists and aristocrats will be held on a short leash.

column2: A secret project has borne fruit. Aircraft contractors and rocket engineers have joined forces, and the project manager has presented the theoretical results to the General Staff. It is believed that further empirical research can lead to a series of Rocket Interceptors.

On estime que des recherches inductives supplémentaires pourraient générer toute une série d’intercepteurs de missiles.
column4: Un progetto segreto sta per dare i suoi frutti. I produttori di aeromobili e gli ingegneri missilistici hanno unito le loro forze e il responsabile del progetto ha presentato i risultati teorici allo Stato Maggiore. Ci sono buone probabilità che la successiva ricerca empirica porti alla realizzazione di una serie di intercettatori con propulsione a razzo.
column5: Un proyecto secreto ha fructificado. Ci sono buone probabilità che la successiva ricerca empirica porti alla realizzazione di una serie di ASM, che possono fornirci velivoli di appoggio da vicino incrementando le nostre capacità di attacco navale.

column2: The 1936 TUC Congress has been opened with much fanfare. This is the most important political event of the year, as it is now that new ministers are appointed and (although it is not explicitly mentioned) changes in Union policy are made and announced. This years congress will probably be a bit special though. Long-time TUC chairman Philip Snowden has long indicated that he intends to withdraw following this congress, and the stakes are high. Rivalling factions are forming behind the curtains, and the decentralizationist Authonomists, led by Niclas y Glais, centralizationist Maximists (Oswald Mosley), status quo socialist Federationists (Arthur Horner) and radical egalitarian paci-isolationist Congregationalists (Annie Kenney) are all wying for superiority in the TUC. Whatever the outcome, this will surely be a thing to remember...

column2: After the Franco- German war of 1870 to 1871, the Sedantag was established in Germany to celebrate the 1870 victory in the battle of Sedan. Originally a holiday to honour the Prussian military, the Sedantag transformed under the reign of Wilhelm II into a day to celebrate the foundation of the German empire, and after the Weltkrieg the defeat of those forces that tried to destroy the Reich. Thoughout every town and village from Aachen to Memel, every street is decorated in black, white, and red. Every bell proudly proclaims this day of celebration. Nobilitiy, officers, soldiers, and unnumbered veterans parade proudly thought the streets, cheered by the happy masses. People sing patriotic songs, have pickniks with friends and family, play music, and dance around bonfires. Indeed, this is a good day, a day that reminds us of the peace and prosperity we have enjoyed since the german unification.

column2: Luise Hoffmann was the first German woman to gain a pilot's license. After her 1933 transatlantic solo flight and her role as a scout pilot in the 1936 Neuschwabenland Expedition, she has become one of Germany's most famous aviation pioneers, along with notable pilots like Manfred von Richthofen, and Gunther Pluschow. Today, Fraulein Hoffmann has acomplished a new long distance record in her customized Fokker F-IX. Starting in Tahiti 36 hours ago, Fraulein Hoffmann today landed savely in Lae on German New Guinea, where she was welcomed by a jubilous crowd and governor Albert Hahl. It is rumored by now that Hoffmann will soon attempt a solo flight around the world. This would place her at a direct competition with the Red Baron who is planning a similar endeavor.

column2: The Archbishop of Melbourne, Daniel Mannix had always been a thorn in the side of the Re-British Australian Government, and notably was one of the key players fighting against Hughes' Conscription Plebiscites in World War 1, only escaping retribution while hiding behind the cloth. While at a public rally to denounce the current Government, three bullets pierced his chest from an unknown sniper and he was later pronounced dead. Exacerbating the matter worse this has happened in the high-time of nationalism between Australia and New Zealand Days. In this chaos now, we can't be sure who did the deed, but the public is sure. We must now officially announce the results of our 'inquest' into the matter. There is the option of blaming a rogue faction of the party, however this is likely to backfire on us!

column2: These are violent and turbulent times we are all living in. There are many threats to the west, to the north and to the east that endanger the independence and sovereignty of us and our neighbours. To the east, Afghanistan, threatened by the eventual war in India that will spill over into their borders and Azerbaijan to the North, whose oil fields in Baku are vunerable and a large priority for the Ottomans and the Russians both. We have come up with an idea, a treaty we can propose to both of our neighbors. The treaty will guarantee all of our indepence and we will enter a pact on Non-aggression.

We have come up with an idea, a treaty we can propose to both of our neighbors. The treaty will guarantee all of our indepence and we will enter a pact on Non-aggression.

column2: Persia has proposed a treaty. In it, we guarantee their independence and Afghanistan's and we enter a Non-Aggression pact with them both. Our oil fields in the Baku Province are some of the largest in the World, making us one of the most threatened countries in the World. We may need Persia and Afghanistan for protection.

column2: Twenty-five years since the end of the Persian Constitutional Revolution, Qajar Persia remains a country struggling with internal fragmentation. The constitutional monarchy’s government is mostly stable thanks to the efforts of prime minister Nosrat ed-Dowleh and his predecessor Abdulhusayn Teymurtash, but the army is divided between the pro-German gendarmerie and the Entente-aligned Cossack Division, whose former commander Reza Khan still lurks in the shadows of ambition since his dismissal for brutality in 1921. The clergy and the modernists engage in daily political battles in the Majles regarding the pace of reforms and the French backed socialist Hezb-e Tudeh Iran maintains a worrying underground presence in the countryside. The current parliamentary mandate is due to expire in 1937 and many fear what fresh elections will bring troubled Persia...

column2: The Persian army has been in a terrible state ever since the Constitutional Revolution. The officers of the Cossack Brigade continue to argue with their counterparts in the Gendarmerie over the question of tactics and doctrines, making the army divisions ineffective and divided. If the next election is to proceed amicably and the Qajar dynasty retain the throne, the feud between the various corps will have to cease. His majesty will have to make a decision. Should we support the firepower doctrine of the pro-German gendarmerie or support the light infantry pro-Entente Cossacks?

column2: Election Day has finally come to Persia! From Tehran to Shiraz and from the Mesopotamian border to the peaks of the Hindukush the electorate is scuttling to cast their vote. Four major parties are standing for election. Furthest to the right is the Traditionalist coalition of conservative nobles and reactionary members of the ulema. More moderate and progressive, the Revival Party of former premier Teymourtash campaigns for a more efficient and liberal administration while favouring free market economics. Current finance minister Mosaddegh is leading the centre-left National Front whilst the most leftist party allowed to run is the social democratic Democrat Party. The polls are unable to predict any winner and as such the people are awaiting the results eagerly.

The polls are unable to predict any winner and as such the people are awaiting the results eagerly.

column2: Ukraine, a Former territory of the Russian Empire has fallen to the Syndicalsts. Led by that boar Khruschev, they have already begun to redistribute the land. They are a threat to the stability of the region, and it would be in our best interests to reincorporate them...but...it may be safer to first gain German permission before entering in any military campaigns in the territory of their former ally. The foreign minister has come up with a treaty that we can propose to the Kaiser. In exchange for giving us a free-hand in Ukraine, we will enter in a mutual defense agreement.

column2: A Historic Day, The Golden Gate Bridge of San Francisco was completed by Joseph Strauss and his team of engineers. It connects the city of San Francisco on the northern tip of the San Francisco Peninsula to Marin County as part of US Highway 101 and California State Highway 1. The Golden Gate Bridge is the largest suspension bridge in the world and reporters and journalists from all over have come to the Grand Opening which will be held next week amidst the political turmoil and crisis in the Midwest, a stark contrast to the situation and economic prosperity that has been seen by the West which this bridge has become a symbol of.

column2: In Detroit, Michigan, Automotive Capital of the World, leaders of the United Auto Workers Walter Reuther and Richard Frankensteen called a general strike against the Ford Motor Company and begin which they called "Unionism, Not Fordism," demanding higher pay and less hours. At 2:00 PM today, a photographer from the Detroit Free Press asked to take a photo of the Leaders of the UAW standing on the overpass with the Ford sign in the background. While they were posing, 40 men with batons from the Ford's Service Department, an internal security force came from behind and began to beat them. The group then beat some of the beret-wearing women arriving to pass out leaflets.

column2: A Heat Wave has struck the Continental United States and Canada, the most severe heat wave in the Modern History of North America. 'The Great Heat Wave' started in late June, went up over 100°F (38°C) as the Drought conditions worsened due to a lack of rain. Now, into July, the heat has reached all time records. In Steele, North Dakota, temperatures reached 121°F (50°C). In Ohio, temperatures reached 110°F (43°C), which was close to tying a record high set in 1934. It comes in a time of major political unrest, with the America First Council a major force in Midwest Politics, Socialist and Syndicalist mobs and militias are gathering arms in the Great Lakes region. The drought is continuing, and there have been over 3000 reported deaths. Many people are suffering from heat stroke, and heat exhaustion. Farmers across the continent saw their worst harvest on record, causing corn and wheat prices to rise quickly and this Heat Wave does not seem to be giving up any time soon.

column2: It was a joyful day in the General Staff. Champagne and caviar was on the tables and the Kaiser showed himself at his best. Mother Russia had been mauled as victorious German armies marched through St. Petersburg, Tsaritsyn and Moscow.  Everyone was now waiting for the Kaiser's decision. It was to be made public here at this very moment.

column2: Today begins the seven day long celebrations of the Chinese New Year. This is an especially important New Year, because it begins a new sixty year cycle, starting with the year of the Rat. It is the most important of the traditional Chinese holidays. The first day of Chinese New Year is a time when families visit the oldest and most senior member of their extended family, usually their parents, grandparents or great-grandparents.

column2: The Security legislation has passed the first reading and is now before the House of Lords. Some fear the British exiles within the Upper House will kill the legislation. The House of Lords is now voting on the bill. It will be decided whether the changes made to the government, army, economy and domestic security remain.
column9: The Security legislation has passed the first reading and is now before the House of Lords. Some fear the British exiles within the Upper House will kill the legislation. The House of Lords is now voting on the bill. It will be decided whether the changes made to the government, army, economy and domestic security remain.

column2: Canada has been able to avoid the bitter class war that engulfed Britain after the Great War, but conflict between Anglo-Canadians and British exiles is growing. Some of this has lead to the development of several groups calling for rapproachment with the Union of Britain. The Tories want to crack down on these groups and have proposed that a new parliamentary committee be formed with executive power over the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and a new civilian intelligence agency with Conservative M.P. Robert Manion as its Chairman. Such a committee would be the first of its kind in Canada and would cut back on many civil liberties and union rights. Ernest Lapointe, the Solicitor-General, has suggested that some symbolic laws be passed to bring some of the Tories on side and that a weaker committee be created with Louis St. Laurent as its chairman, while the Progressives are adamant that no infringement of their civil rights take place. However, the issue is clear, Canada must re-organize and streamline it’s overly bureaucratic security forces.

column2: When the revolution succeeded in Britain, it forced Canada to become the senior member of the Empire. While Canada was able to seize the Caribbean, we were unable to secure the rest of the Empire and had to rely on the Australasians to secure a perimeter around their territory. Many regard this as a result of our small army at that time, and many would like resurrect the conscription bill. However, the Prime Minister is a Liberal in the mold of Sir Wilfrid Laurier and will not lightly allow such a divisive law to be promulgated without intense debate. The conservatives want universal conscription, while the progressives within the Liberal party have threatened to leave if the government goes ahead. Conscription is deeply unpopular, especially in Quebec. The Prime Minister has declared “Conscription if necessary, but not necessarily conscription!” Many are taking this as a sign that he is working to build a consensus.

column2: When the Great war began, the British Prime Minister Herbert Asquith said that industry would proceed as ‘Business as Usual’. The ensuing shell crisis and the difficulty found in equipping the British army has shown us that if another war were to start, we will need a mobilized war economy. However, most businessmen aren’t willing to invest in a specialized facilities such as Heavy Bomber factories that such an economy would require. Some Conservative MP’s are proposing that part of the Security bill include a provision to immediately nationalize such key war industries. While this wouldn’t increase the size of our industrial capacity, it would cut down on a lot of red tape. C.D. Howe, the minister of munitions, argues that the government subsidize the creation of such industries that entrepreneurs would lease at very preferable rates and provide the labour which would increase the number of factories, but limit their efficiency by working with the private sector. Some MP’s are arguing for a compromise where the government will nationalize the specialized industries that require a great deal of sophistication while subsidizing the more basic ones already in place.

column2: The King’s Ascension marks the beginning of a new era. The ad hoc and difficult task of strengthening Canadian industry, integrating the Royal Navy and finding a place for the hundreds of thousands of British Exiles has been a trying test for Canada, but we have survived the initial storm. We are stronger now, but now we must refine our strengths so that they will equal those of the other great powers. The Prime Minister and his government are therefore putting together a comprehensive security and military bill that will address the various national interests facing Canada. The legislation will be known as Bill C-7.

The legislation will be known as Bill C-7.

column2: Prime Minister King’s government now has a comfortable majority after the defeat of R.B. Bennett’s conservative party and his British backers but not all is secure. George V is growing steadily worse in health and, despite his sickness, continues to oppose the moderating influence of the Prime Minister on Canadian politics. Senile and Obsessed with reclaiming the Empire, George V lends credibility to the British exiles who now sit in the Canadian House of Lords, (formerly known as the Senate before the Syndicalist revolt) whose presence in the upper house threatens to endanger the Prime Minister’s legislative program. While Canada has grown strong by an influx of expertise, capital and technology, it remains an uncertain player on the world stage. The next few years of King’s government will decisively shape the country’s future…

column2: With his father dead, Edward the Prince of Wales will be coronated King-Emperor of the British Empire. Two large factions within the Canadian political sphere has coalesced, one led by the Prime Minister who seek to develop and refine Canada’s industrial strength and harvest its resources over foreign policy, and the other led by R.B. Bennett and his supporters in the British diaspora who wish to mobilize the Canadian economy to launch an invasion of the Union of Britain in the near future, even if that means accelerating arms production at the expense of civil liberties. The Prince of Wales is popular in both French and English Canada and his views may very well sway the opinions of others. He could prove to be vulnerable to the arguments of either group depending on how well they make their case to him…

column2: The new King has been invested with the Royal Regalia in the First Anglican Church of Ottawa. Jubliant crowds from all over Canada gather in the cities to celebrate a new age of Canadian royalty! They eagerly anticipate the new King’s first radio address to the nation.
column9: The new King has been invested with the Royal Regalia in the First Anglican Church of Ottawa. Jubliant crowds from all over Canada gather in the cities to celebrate a new age of Canadian royalty! They eagerly anticipate the new King’s first radio address to the nation.

column2: The King has spoken to the nation and has electrified it. From Vancouver to St. John, from Toronto to the Arctic, Canadians everywhere buzz with excitement after hearing a charismatic and forceful speech denouncing syndicalism and the King’s pledge to finish the war that his father began and reclaim Britain. Canadians were warned to never trust the Union of Britain or its insidious syndicalist allies!

column2: Two weeks ago, Professional Austrian wrestler Adolf 'Hardcore' Hitler challenged Japan's top wrestler Chiyotenzan Takeyoshi to a standard wrestling match. Takeyoshi accepted, but only if the match were on Sacred Japanese soil, Hitler, without hesitation agreed and today they met for the first time in the ring. After 23 total minutes, Hitler won the match with his signature move, the 'Heil Driver'. The match was watched by wrestling fans all around the World, and the Painter turned Pro Wrestler even got a chance to meet with the Habsburg when he returned from Tokyo.

column2: The Puerto Rican Nationalist Party Seizes the Capitol Building
column9: The Puerto Rican Nationalist Party Seizes the Capitol Building

column2: Two weeks after being released from jail, the reason for his imprisonment being his viewpoints, Puerto Rican Nationalist Party leader Dr. Pedro Albizu Campos, or 'El Maestro' held a speech in San Juan Plaza, reinforcing his position that the Puerto Rican Nationalists should take whatever steps are necessary to gain Puerto Rico's independence. He pointed out what he saw as the hypocrisy of a United States crackdown on the Puerto Rican Nationalists, he argues that Puerto Rico has as much right to fight for their independence as the United States had in 1775. Three hours after his speech, at 21:45, Dr. Campos lead an armed party of Nationalists into the San Juan capitol building and replaced the American flag that was hoisted on the roof with the flag used by the rebels during the Lares Rebellion. Militias all across the island have followed the Doctor's lead. We have lost control of Puerto Rico.

column2: We have forced the German monarchy to flee the country and liberated the German people. The war continues, but we are one step closer to liberating all of Europe! We have been contacted by Socialist and Syndicalist leaders alike in Rhineland, Bavaria, Northern Germany and Prussia who have decided to cooperate. By rewarding them, we could give them Independence, while watching over their shoulder of course. There is another option, giving only Rhineland their independence and occupying the rest of the country. Then, there is the most radical and costly option, occupy the whole country ourselves.

column2: Three years from today, Father Charles Coughlin started doing weekly a radio broadcast in America and more than 50 million people turn on their radios and listen. He is a raving Anti-Semite, claiming that the Syndicalist Revolution in France was 'foremented by the Jew' and that the Berlin Stock Market Crash is an 'International Conspiracy of Jewish Baners' and somehow people still tune in. His hate-speech will not betolerated by the Church, and the Pope is expected to make a decision whether to ask the United States government to shut down his broadcast so his hateful message cannot reach the public.

column2: Three years from today, Father Charles Coughlin started doing weekly radio broadcast on CBS and more than 50 million turn on their radios and listen. He is a raving Anti-Semite, claiming that the Syndicalist Revolution in France was 'foremented by the Jew' and that the Berlin Stock Market Crash is an 'International Conspiracy of Jewish Baners' and somehow people still tune in. The Roman Catholic Church has begun to take notice, and have condemnded his actions, asking that we shut his hate speech down immediately. He is a founding member of the dangerous and radical American First party and he claims if the America First doesn't get 10 million votes in the upcoming election he'll hang up his mic. We may be able to speed us his depature from CBS Radio and force him off the air by refusing to renew his permit.

column2: La Troisième Internationale
column9: La Troisième Internationale

column2: Sao Paulo was hit hard by the Berlin Stock Market Crash. Brasil has a heavy dependence on foreign markets and loans. Despite limited industrial development in São Paulo, the export of coffee and other primary products is still the mainstay of the economy. Days after the Berlin stock market crash, coffee quotations immediately fell 30 percent. The subsequent decline was even sharper.

column2: Government policies are designed to favor foreign interests, which has exasperated the crisis we are facing, leaving the regime alienated from just about every segment of society. Following the Berlin panic, the government attempted to please foreign creditors by maintaining convertibility according to the money principles preached by the foreign bankers and economists who set the terms for Brazil's relations with the world economy, despite lacking any support from a single major sector in Brazilian society.

column2: Syndicalist leader Astrojildo Pereira has been stirring up dissent in the coastal, urban cities of Brasil and he is beginning to gather a following. Many of the immigrants who came from Eastern and Southern Europe during and after the Great War brought ideas of Anarchism, Socialism and Syndicalism along with them and they have begun to root themselves into Brasilian politics. Brasil was hit by its first wave of general strikes and the establishment of the Syndicalist Party in 1921. Not to mention the Northeastern sugar barons have bitterly opposed Artur da Silva Bernardes since his inauguration and are rumored to be making an alliance with the Nationalists.

column2: We are nearing the end of 1936 and already Brasil's gold reserves have been depleted, pushing the exchange rate down to a new low. World demand for Brasil's primary products have fallen far too drastically to maintain government revenues. The government is stuck in a deepening balance-of-payments crisis, and the coffee growers are struck with an unsellable harvest. Since power ultimately rests on patronage, wide-scale defections in the delicate balance of regional interests left the regime quite vulnerable.

column2: Astrojildo Pereira, leader of the Brasilian Worker's Party has stepped up his efforts to undermine the Central Government. He has held a mass rally in the city of Brasilia and has called out for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes or he will storm the Palácio do Planalto himself and force him and his cabinet to resign. if we dont do something, we may have a revolution on our hands.

He has held a mass rally in the city of Brasilia and has called out for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes or he will storm the Palácio do Planalto himself and force him and his cabinet to resign. if we dont do something, we may have a revolution on our hands.

column2: The Palácio do Planalto, The Presidential Palace has been surrounded by angry mob of peasants that came out of the Guetos after the arrest of Astrojildo Pereira in his home in Brasilia yesterday evening. The mob is calling for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes as well as the release of Astrojildo Pereira. Roughly 30 percent of the military is behind the mob, and a confrontation would be disastrous no matter the immediate results.

Roughly 20 percent of the military is behind the mob, and a confrontation would be disastrous no matter the immediate results.
column9: The Palácio do Planalto, The Presidential Palace has been surrounded by angry mob of peasants that came out of the Guetos after a speech made by Astrojildo Pereira in Brasilia yesterday evening. The mob is calling for the resignation of President Artur da Silva Bernardes. Roughly 20 percent of the military is behind the mob, and a confrontation would be disastrous no matter the immediate results.

column2: Yesterday, the Presidential Guard were given orders to crush the mob outside the Palace. The Presidential Guard, small in numbers, their morale at an all-time low refused to fire on their own country-men and went into hiding. Today, the President made a final radio adress and was found in his office with a gun-shot wound to the head. Now, the future of Brasil hangs in the balance. The Sugar Barons have been waiting for a moment like this, as well as the military.

column2: Joaquín Ascaso Budriá has taken the stage and elaborated the position of the CNT-FAI in Spain for the Congress. The CNT-FAI is the largest Syndicalist party in Spain, made up of Anarcho-Syndicalists, moderate Syndicalists and trade unionists. The Spanish Revolutionaries have been seen White Terror, violent counter-revolutionary actions taking against the Workers first-hand. They have come, asking for support for their cause when the moment comes.

column2: American journalist, poet and Syndicalist activist John 'Jack' Reed spoke to the Congress for an hour and fifthteen minutes about the crisis facing the United States and the chance for Revolution in the Western Hemisphere. In the South, the American First Committe is stronger than the Central Government and the North is suffering from a depression as the West Coast prospers. If the United States were to crumble in the face of a Revolution, then the Exiles would be paralyzed.

column2: American journalist, poet and Syndicalist activist John 'Jack' Reed spoke to the Congress for an hour and fifthteen minutes about the crisis facing the United States and the chance for Revolution in the Western Hemisphere. Following in the footsteps of Benjamin Franklin, Mr. Reed laid out the situation in America very clearly. In the South, the American First Committe is stronger than the Central Government and the North is suffering from a depression as the West Coast prospers. This economic imbalance has caused massive unemployment along the Great Lakes, and the people are ready for a radical change.

column2: The Latin American countries were the hardest hit of all by the Stock Market Crash in Berlin and there has been a Great Awakening among the people. Socialist and Syndicalist parties grow larger by the day, paired with Unemployment. We should decide our policy on Latin America, where left-wing radicalism is getting ripe.

column2: Today the British feminists, Helen Crawfurd took the stage with her flaming speach about the women's role in the World Revolution. According to her arguments, without women's participation in industry and armed forces, it may be impossible to defeat the many enemies of the proletariat. However, heeding this call is likely to cause some disturbances among the more 'conservative' elements of the society.

column2: Yesterday Helen Crawfurd took the stage with her flaming speach about the women's role in the World Revolution. According to her arguments, without women's participation in industry and armed forces, it may be impossible to defeat the many enemies of the proletariat. Tempting as it may seem, the political climate in Britain is not ready for such decision - we need to wait for the Congress of Trade Unions in the fall to force the matter.

column2: The Propylaen publishing house, in association with the Grossdeutche Partei, has today announced the intention to release a new series of books devoted to individual German soldiers' stories, accounts and poetry from the conflicts of the Weltkrieg. Notable examples include the diary of Sergant Adolf Hitler, a signalman who amongst other distinctions was awarded no less than two Iron Crosses for his valour on the Western and Eastern fronts. The diaries were produced during the German intervention in Russia, and provide a unique and fiery insight into the nature of the bitter ideological struggle. What better way to re-affirm the values and continuing glory of the Reich in these troubled times?.

What better way to re-affirm the values and continuing glory of the Reich in these troubled times?.

column2: Follow the widespread popularity of the bestselling series produced by Propylaen, film director Wunderkind Leni Riefenstahl resolved to turn the material into a movie based on the accounts given. 'Unser Kampf', Our Struggle, boasts the highest production values hitherto seen, and offers a frightingly real depiction of the war. Starring Heinz Ruhmann, Hans Albers and Theodor Loos the story focuses on the heroism and dedication of the "small people" in the war such as the valient Corporal Adolf Hitler, who sacrificed everything for his Kaiser and the Reich.

column2: This evening, all of Germany flocks to the movie theatres. Even the hardships of the economic crisis can't stop true fans to see the darling of all Germany, Marlene Dietrich, in her newest movie! 'Metropolis', directed by movie Wunderkind Leni Riefenstahl, tells the story of a futuristic city, besieged by savages, and the struggles of Metropolis' citizens. Also starring Hans Albers, Rudof Klein- Rogge, and Gustav Frohlich.

column2: In The Swiss Province of Romandy, Pro-French leaders have been calling for their right to secede from Switzerland, a move that created enormous tension between France and the Swiss Federation. We have heard horror stories from Switzerland of White Terror, violent actions taken by Reactionaries against the people and the Revolution. We may be able to act in the pretext of defending the French Swiss and Revolutionaries and gain the Romandy Province.

column2: At the end of 1936 the Canadian military was at a crossroads. The vision to take back the home islands had been the predominant vision for the Canadian military, but many see this as an unrealistic goal and are looking for a change to the current thinking. Conservatives in the country still believe that retaking the isles is the best approach, but the liberals are concerned that the effort to take the isles is leading Canada atray and believe that Canada comes first. Whatever the decision, the future of the Canadian military will be decided here.

column2: Wilfred Curtis has approached the Prime Minister with a new plan to further the expansion of the airforce. This proposal is even more ambitious than the plans of Bishop and would call for great reform. The problem with the proposal is that it recommends that this be a Canada first endeavour and calls for the removal of older RAF advisors from the program to get a fresh perspective. This will lead to most of the older British advisors from the prerevolution days being removed from offices of influence.

column2: After the death of Hans von Seeckt and the retirement of August von Mackensen, the Chief of General Staff has been involved in constant debate over which methods the German Army should use as a tactical basis, or doctrine. The traditionalists argue that superior firepower won the Weltkrieg, and would do so again, whereas the new school argues that this will be made obsolete and that a new form of mobility and strong spearheads should be the doctrine to base the German Army on. There also exists a self-deemed compromise faction, which argues that the current interim leaders should simply be made permanent.
column9: After the death of Hans von Seeckt and the retirement of August von Mackensen, the Chief of General Staff has been involved in constant debate over which methods the German Army should use as a tactical basis, or doctrine. The traditionalists argue that superior firepower won the Weltkrieg, and would do so again, whereas the new school argues that this will be made obsolete and that a new form of mobility and strong spearheads should be the doctrine to base the German Army on. There also exists a self-deemed compromise faction, which argues that the current interim leaders should simply be made permanent.

column2: Each group within the General Staff has nominated canidates for Chief of Staff and Chief of the Army. Surprisingly, Heinz Guderian, the leader of the mobility faction, was not nominated. The argument was that the Kaiser would more willingly support a nobleman. Guderian accepted and encouraged this decision. The Kaiser is about to address the General Staff in Berlin. Everyone, from soldiers to generals to journalists, awaits his decision.
